title: New Specialized S-Works Mondo tyre is hookless-friendly and built for rougher roads
content:
Cyclist
New Specialized S-Works Mondo tyre is hookless-friendly and built for rougher roads

The new Specialized S-Works Mondo tubeless-ready tyre is designed for wet and dry grip and speed on a variety of road surfaces. It uses two compounds for durability and grip, and has a new sidewall protection layer. 

The S-Works Mondo tyre is available in 28mm, 32mm and 35mm widths, with claimed weights of 310g, 330g and 360g and is priced at £55.

Go anywhere tyre

The new Specialized S-Works Mondo tyre was spotted at this year’s Paris-Roubaix and has now been officially launched. Specialized bills the tyre as an endurance all-road tyre, built for durability, all-weather traction and puncture protection, making it well-suited for the gruelling parcours of Paris-Roubaix. It sits in Specialized’s tyre range between its Turbo and Roubaix tyres.

As you’d expect for a new tyre, it’s also tubeless-ready and comes in fashionably wide 28mm, 32mm and 35mm options. Unlike Specialized’s other road tyres, there’s no 23mm to 26mm tyre offered, reflecting the general move away from narrower tyres on road bikes. The 35mm tyre is also wider than the brand’s older tyre ranges, which typically top out at 30mm or 32mm width.

Specialized emphasises the S-Works Mondo tyre’s suitability whatever the road surface, claiming that it delivers ‘race-like speed, insane tread life and next-level puncture protection’, making it a ‘go-anywhere, do-anything’ tyre option. The tyre has a slick central section with a fine herringbone tread on the shoulders though, so it might not be the best choice for an off-road excursion onto a muddy bridleway; Specialized bills it for tarmac, cobble and light gravel use.

Specialized claims that the tyre’s construction offers class-leading performance for an endurance tyre, with 11 per cent lower rolling resistance and 12 per cent better puncture protection, while being 5 per cent lighter than the competition. It’s also compatible with hookless rims, although Specialized’s own wheel rims are hooked and the brand emphasises the need to keep within the recommended rim pressures if your wheels are hookless.

The tyre’s dual-compound tread comprises Specialized’s Gripton T2 compound for the central tread, which it claims offers high speed and durability. The shoulders use Gripton T5, which Specialized says offers great wet and dry grip. Under-tread protection comes from Specialized’s Black Belt breaker. There’s also a new sidewall protection layer, that Specialized calls Grid Race, which is designed to be supple but provide abrasion and pinch flat resistance.

At a claimed 310g for a 28mm tyre, the S-Works Mondo is competitively lightweight. For comparison, we weighed the 28mm Continental GP5000 AS TR tyre that we recently reviewed at 346g and the 28mm Vittoria Corsa N.Ext at 302g. It’s also reasonably priced with an SRP of £55 as against the Conti’s £90-ish, although the Vittoria tyre costs the same as the S-Works Mondo.

Specialized S-Works Mondo tyre specs

Sizes available: 28mm, 32mm, 35mm

Weights: 310g (28mm), 330g (32mm), 360g (36mm)

SRP: £55
